plugins.name: Round Width to 8
plugins.description:
Make your designs cleaner and more consistent with this simple plugin that rounds the width of selected elements up to the next multiple of 8. Great for enforcing 8px spacing systems, aligning to design tokens, or preparing components for dev handoff.


Just select one or more resizable elements and run the plugin — no UI, no fuss.
plugins.tagline: Rounds element widths up to the next multiple of 8 — clean, consistent, and dev-ready.

127315.tagline: Rounds element widths up to the next multiple of 8 — clean, consistent, and dev-ready.

plugins.name: Export to Denada
plugins.description:
Effortlessly create, customize, and refine HTML emails in seconds with Denada. Your brand. Your voice. Your rules. It's like magic.


This plugin is the easiest way to export your Figma designs into Denada.


How to Export Images to Denada:


  1. In Figma, select a layer to export, then right-click > Plugins > Export to Denada
  2. Name the image, paste in Denada API Token then Export to Denada
  3. The exported image will now appear in your Denada image collection


The image is linked.


  1. If you alter your image on Figma, just export it again and click "update available" in Denada


How to get a Denada API Token:


  1. In Denada, go to Settings (User must be a manager or higher)
  2. Click Create Token, Name Token
  3. Copy Token
plugins.tagline: Export your Figma assets to Denada's image library, in one click.

121997.name: Export to Denada
121997.description:
Effortlessly create, customize, and refine HTML emails in seconds with Denada. Your brand. Your voice. Your rules. It's like magic.


This plugin is the easiest way to export your Figma designs into Denada.


How to Export Images to Denada:


  1. In Figma, select a layer to export, then right-click > Plugins > Export to Denada
  2. Name the image, paste in Denada API Token then Export to Denada
  3. The exported image will now appear in your Denada image collection


The image is linked.


  1. If you alter your image on Figma, just export it again and click "update available" in Denada


How to get a Denada API Token:


  1. In Denada, go to Settings (User must be a manager or higher)
  2. Click Create Token, Name Token
  3. Copy Token
121997.release_notes: Allow exporting any layer, not just Frame layers.
121997.tagline: Export your Figma assets to Denada's image library, in one click.

plugins.name: Layout Aware Renaming
plugins.description:
Features

- Auto-Detect Grids: Automatically detects rows and columns in your selection.

- Custom Naming: Add prefixes and choose between numeric or alphabetic suffixes.

- Manual Override: Specify exact rows/columns when auto-detection fails.

- Mixed Sizes: Works with elements of different sizes in the same grid.

- Figma & FigJam: Compatible with both Figma and FigJam (limited support).
plugins.tagline: Automatically rename elements based on their grid layout.

116823.name: Layout Aware Renaming
116823.description:

- Figma & FigJam: Compatible with both Figma and FigJam (limited support).
116823.tagline: Automatically rename elements based on their grid layout.

plugins.name: Namer | Неймер
plugins.description:
Namer renames selected frames based on their position (top-to-bottom, left-to-right) on the canvas, ignoring layer hierarchy. Adds sequential numbers with your custom prefix: Prefix_1, Prefix_2, etc.


Неймер переименовывает выбранные фреймы по их расположению на рабочей области (сверху-вниз, слева-направо), игнорируя иерархию слоев. Добавляет порядковые номера с вашим префиксом: Префикс_1, Префикс_2 и т.д.


How to Use / Как использовать:

  1. Select frames → Open plugin → Click "Переименовать".
  2. Выберите фреймы → Запустите плагин → Нажмите «Переименовать».
plugins.tagline: Rename frames by position, not layers. / Переименовывает фреймы по расположению, а не слоям.

128205.name: Namer | Неймер
128205.description:
Namer renames selected frames based on their position (top-to-bottom, left-to-right) on the canvas, ignoring layer hierarchy. Adds sequential numbers with your custom prefix: Prefix_1, Prefix_2, etc.

How to Use / Как использовать:

  2. Выберите фреймы → Запустите плагин → Нажмите «Переименовать».
128205.tagline: Rename frames by position, not layers. / Переименовывает фреймы по расположению, а не слоям.

plugins.name: Maruco
plugins.description:
What is this?

Maruco is a plugin that provides rules and validation for component naming, helping you identify components that violate naming conventions and elements.


1. Selecting naming convention.

There are several conventions, let's select the best one for your project.


2. Entering naming elements.

Next, you can enter "words" that makes up the component's name.

Enter a comma between words to set multiple words.

Maruco guesses that the component's name is made up of three elements: a prefix, a middle word and a suffix.


3. Running validation.

That's all. Let's run the validation.
plugins.tagline: Effortless rule creation for component naming.

117124.tagline: Effortless rule creation for component naming.

plugins.name: 数据生成图表可视化工具（专业版） Data Vision Chart Pro
plugins.description:
Introduction

This plugin enables users to create beautiful and interactive charts directly within Figma. Whether you need a bar, line, donut, or pie chart, the plugin offers real-time updates and customizable styles for seamless data visualization.


Function Description

  1. Create different chart types: Line, Bar, Donut, and Pie charts.
  2. Customize chart styles with predefined themes or use custom colors.
  3. Easily add, edit, and remove data rows with an intuitive interface.
  4. Export generated charts directly as Figma frames for further design use.
  5. Support for multiple languages, including English, Simplified Chinese, Traditional Chinese, Hindi, Japanese, and Korean.


Usage Instructions

  1. Select the chart type you want to create.
  2. Input the required data and choose a predefined color scheme or customize it.
  3. Set the chart dimensions (width and height) as per your design needs.
  4. Click "Generate Chart" to create the chart frame in Figma.
  5. Customize the chart further by adjusting colors and data points as needed.


Notes

  1. The plugin supports dynamic data updates and real-time chart previews.
  2. Ensure that all necessary data rows are filled to avoid incomplete chart generation.
  3. You can switch between chart types to explore different data visualizations.


介绍

此插件让用户可以直接在 Figma 中创建漂亮且交互式的图表。无论是柱状图、折线图、环形图还是饼图，插件都提供实时更新和自定义样式，助力轻松进行数据可视化。


功能说明

  1. 支持生成不同类型的图表：折线图、柱状图、环形图和饼图。
  2. 提供多种预设主题配色，或使用自定义颜色。
  3. 直观界面，轻松添加、编辑和删除数据行。
  4. 将生成的图表直接导出为 Figma 的框架，用于后续设计。
  5. 支持多种语言，包括英语、简体中文、繁体中文、印地语、日语和韩语。


使用方法

  1. 选择您需要创建的图表类型。
  2. 输入所需数据，选择预设配色或自定义颜色。
  3. 根据设计需要设置图表尺寸（宽度和高度）。
  4. 点击“生成图表”按钮，即可在 Figma 中创建图表框架。
  5. 您可以根据需要进一步调整图表的颜色和数据点。


注意事项

  1. 插件支持动态数据更新和实时图表预览。
  2. 确保所有必要的数据行已填写完整，以避免生成不完整的图表。
  3. 您可以在不同的图表类型之间切换，探索不同的数据可视化效果。

accepted.name: KingweiCheung
accepted.description: If you have any questions or suggestions, feel free to contact me at kingweichueng@qq.com.

plugins.tagline: Generate stunning charts for data visualization with ease

plugins.name: Align Auto Layout
plugins.description:
MacOS shortcut setup:

System Settings → Keyboard → Keyboard Shortcuts → App Shortcuts → “+”.

App: Figma.

Menu Title:

Plugins->Align Auto Layout->Move alignment up

(repeat for down/left/right).

Press the desired keys, e.g. ⌃⌥W, and save.

Your new keys now trigger the plugin commands in Figma.
plugins.tagline: Instantly nudge auto-layout frames—left, right, up, down—for lightning-fast design workflows.

138621.name: Align Auto Layout
138621.description:

App: Figma.

Menu Title:

(repeat for down/left/right).

Press the desired keys, e.g. ⌃⌥W, and save.

Your new keys now trigger the plugin commands in Figma.
138621.tagline: Instantly nudge auto-layout frames—left, right, up, down—for lightning-fast design workflows.

plugins.name: Design2Dev
plugins.description:
Design2Dev is a Figma plugin that extracts detailed design specs and generates structured AI prompts for React Native. Map custom UIs to design systems, export specs as JSON, and get production-ready code from ChatGPT, Claude, or Cursor — no guesswork, just clarity.


Description:

Design2Dev bridges the gap between your polished Figma designs and AI-generated React Native code. No more guess-and-check with plain-language prompts—this plugin produces developer-grade output in seconds:


  1. Extract design specs – Build a full JSON mapping of component hierarchy, styles (colours, typography, spacing), layout properties, and design tokens.
  2. Map to UI libraries – Auto-align designs with React Native Paper or other design systems.
  3. Generate AI prompts – Output prompt-ready TXT files formatted to work effortlessly with ChatGPT, Claude, Cursor, Gemini, etc.
  4. Export visuals and specs – Export PNG snapshots of selected frames, and JSON + TXT bundles—ready for automated workflows or human inspection.
  5. Designed for speed – Perfect for solo designers/devs needing accurate code now, not later. No least-common-denominator outputs—just intention-preserving handoffs.


Ideal For:

  1. Designers shipping React Native apps today
  2. Developers optimizing prompt engineering from visuals
  3. Teams wanting clean spec-to-code pipelines before Figma or Bolt catch up
plugins.tagline: Turn Figma Designs into AI-Ready Code Prompts. Instantly.

139506.name: Design2Dev
139506.description:
Design2Dev is a Figma plugin that extracts detailed design specs and generates structured AI prompts for React Native. Map custom UIs to design systems, export specs as JSON, and get production-ready code from ChatGPT, Claude, or Cursor — no guesswork, just clarity.


Description:

Design2Dev bridges the gap between your polished Figma designs and AI-generated React Native code. No more guess-and-check with plain-language prompts—this plugin produces developer-grade output in seconds:


  1. Extract design specs – Build a full JSON mapping of component hierarchy, styles (colours, typography, spacing), layout properties, and design tokens.

139506.tagline: Turn Figma Designs into AI-Ready Code Prompts. Instantly.

plugins.name: Font Classifier
plugins.description:
Font Classifier helps designers sort fonts into custom categories like Serif, Display, Branding, and more.

Quickly preview and apply fonts to selected text layers in Figma without digging through the full font list.

No more scrolling through 1000+ alphabetically listed fonts — just categorize your favorites and access them instantly.

Ideal for web, UI, and graphic designers who want faster access to curated typefaces.

plugins.name: Flow Linker
plugins.description:
In large-scale design projects, prototyping every screen-to-screen interaction isn’t always practical. With dozens or even hundreds of screens, building interactive flows becomes time-consuming and sometimes infeasible, especially when deadlines are tight or priorities shift.


Yet developers and stakeholders still need clarity. They rely on understanding how different screens connect, what the logical flow of a user journey looks like, and where transitions happen even without full prototypes.


That’s where Flow Link comes in.


Rather than investing hours in building out detailed prototypes, Flow Link lets you visually map out interactions using clean, orthogonal connectors. These lines don’t just show flow—they’re configurable, styled, navigable, and reusable. And with frame linking, viewers can even jump directly to connected screens, making your Figma file interactive in structure, even without full prototyping.


Flow Link fills the gap between rapid design iteration and clear developer handoff making complex projects more navigable, understandable, and scalable.
plugins.tagline: Your Figma Flow, Made Effortless.

137680.name: Flow Linker
137680.description:
In large-scale design projects, prototyping every screen-to-screen interaction isn’t always practical. With dozens or even hundreds of screens, building interactive flows becomes time-consuming and sometimes infeasible, especially when deadlines are tight or priorities shift.


Yet developers and stakeholders still need clarity. They rely on understanding how different screens connect, what the logical flow of a user journey looks like, and where transitions happen even without full prototypes.


That’s where Flow Link comes in.


Rather than investing hours in building out detailed prototypes, Flow Link lets you visually map out interactions using clean, orthogonal connectors. These lines don’t just show flow—they’re configurable, styled, navigable, and reusable. And with frame linking, viewers can even jump directly to connected screens, making your Figma file interactive in structure, even without full prototyping.


Flow Link fills the gap between rapid design iteration and clear developer handoff making complex projects more navigable, understandable, and scalable.

plugins.name: Iconize
plugins.description:
Transform any Figma design into a complete set of perfectly scaled Chrome extension icons in seconds.


Benefits:

  1. Save hours of manual work - No more tedious resizing and exporting
  2. Perfect proportions - Maintains design integrity across all sizes
  3. Professional results - Vector paths, text, and effects scale beautifully
  4. Chrome extension ready - Standard sizes (16px, 24px, 36px, 48px, 128px)
  5. Batch processing - Handle multiple designs simultaneously


How to use:

  1. Select your design - Choose any frame, group, component, or instance
  2. Run Iconize - Go to Plugins → Iconize → Scale to Icon Sizes
  3. Get your icons - Five perfectly scaled versions appear instantly
  4. Export to PNG / SVG and use - Icons are named icon16, icon24, icon36, icon48, icon128


Perfect for Chrome extensions, web apps, mobile apps, and any project requiring multiple icon sizes. Works with complex designs including vectors, text, effects, and nested elements.

accepted.name: George Valdes
accepted.description:
Post-architect
I like building, marketing, and selling outcomes

Iconize - Figma Plugin
Zenfiller - Auto Form filler
Zensets - Context engine

plugins.tagline: Instantly generate size appropriate icons at 16px, 24px, 36px, 48px & 128px from any design

plugins.name: Radix color palette
plugins.description:
Step 1: Enter a base color in the Accent section to generate a palette.

Step 2: Copy the accent scale generated below.

Step 3: Copy the CSS code from:

.root, .light, .light-theme { ... }

Step 4: Repeat Steps 1–3 for the Dark Theme.

Step 5: Create a collection in Figma with two modes named exactly: Light Mode, Dark Mode (Case-sensitive)

Step 6: Paste the Light and Dark theme CSS into their respective input fields in the plugin.

Step 7: Click the "Create Variables" button.

Step 8: Edit variable names as needed in Figma.
plugins.tagline: Copy Radix CSS code and paste it here to instantly add your custom palette variables to the file.

plugins.name: Nexus
plugins.description:
Nexus is a Figma plugin designed to seamlessly sync content from Google Sheets while automatically updating text layers and their names.


Built for designers and product teams, Nexus eliminates manual copy-pasting by connecting your Figma files to a centralized content source. Select a language, pick the texts you need, and apply them in one click — layer names and content are updated instantly.


✅ Real-time sync with Google Sheets

✅ Automatic update of text layer content

✅ Structured layer renaming (#BODY.x, #CTA.x)

✅ Clean, intuitive interface for efficient workflows


Save time. Stay consistent. Focus on design.

Nexus handles the repetitive work — you focus on creating.
plugins.tagline: Power Your Workflow

plugins.name: Lokaliser
plugins.description:
Translate smarter, without the bloat.


Lokaliser.io is a lightweight, no-fuss translation management plugin built for lean teams who want to scale globally — without dealing with overwhelming tools.

With this plugin, you can:

🔗 Connect your Figma design to a Lokaliser project

🏷 Assign and manage translation keys right in your file

🔄 Sync keys to/from Lokaliser Cloud (Import / Export - Sync ↓ / Sync ↑)

📌 Keep your UI copy structured, ready for localization

No over-complicated workflows. No unused features. Just what your team needs to make product localization fast, collaborative, and clean.


→ Start your 14-day trial

→ Manage your projects in Lokaliser Dashboard


💡 Perfect for designers, devs & product teams working on multilingual apps & webs. Built by a team who values clarity and simplicity — just like you.

accepted.name: Lokaliser.io

plugins.name: BrowserLens
plugins.description:
This plugin lets you import color styles from the BrowserLens web extension. Insert colors as layers in your design and add palettes to your local styles.


Learn more about BrowserLens: https://browserlens.com/

Documentation: https://docs.browserlens.com/


How to Use

  1. Open any webpage with the BrowserLens extension.
  2. Click export > Figma (BrowserLens Plugin).
  3. Download the style file for Figma.
  4. Run this plugin and upload the style file.
  5. Choose whether to add colors as local styles.
  6. Click 'Import Styles'.


About BrowserLens


BrowserLens is a web extension designed to extract styling and seo information from any webpage without the need for developer tools. It provides a simple UI for extracting and copying webpage information from the current tab.


Extension Features

  1. ⌨️ View fonts used on a webpage and the associated CSS values.
  2. 🖌️ Extract colors from a webpage and click to copy color value.
  3. 🌅 Extract gradients from a webpage and click to copy CSS value.
  4. 🎨 Export color palettes to Figma.
  5. 🌐 Preview SEO data including page meta, OpenGraph tags and Twitter Card data.
  6. ✅ Check SEO meta for best practices including title and description length.
  7. 🖼️ List all images present on a page and click to download, including background images.
  8. 🌃 Dark mode support.

accepted.name: BrowserLens
accepted.description:
Extract colors, fonts, media and seo meta from any site without using developer tools. 

Available for Chrome, Firefox and Edge

plugins.tagline: Import styles from the BrowserLens web extension

plugins.name: Zeytal Variables Extractor
plugins.description:
Zeytal helps developers extract and optimize SVGs, transform Figma styles and variables, and generate TailwindCSS config files effortlessly.


This plugin helps Zeytal users leverage their Figma variables.


Zeytal Features

  1. Extract and optimize SVGs
  2. Extract and convert Figma variables to .ts, .js, .json, .css, .scss, .sass, and .less files
  3. Extract and convert Figma styles to .ts, .js, .json, .css, .scss, .sass, and .less files
  4. Convert Figma styles and variables to TailwindCSS v4 config files.


This Plugin

This plugin helps Figma users prepare their Figma files for Figma variables extraction and code generation.


How it works :

  1. Start the plugin.
  2. Click on one button to export your Figma variables to Zeytal
  3. Use Zeytal CLI to generate your code and config files


Everything is explained in detail in Zeytal documentation.
plugins.tagline: From Figma to Code In One Command Line

133510.name: Zeytal Variables Extractor
133510.description:

Zeytal Features

  3. Extract and convert Figma styles to .ts, .js, .json, .css, .scss, .sass, and .less files
  4. Convert Figma styles and variables to TailwindCSS v4 config files.


This Plugin

plugins.name: Figma to osu!framework
plugins.description:
A third-party plugin to convert Figma elements to osu!framework code


Supported features:

  1. Basic layout (RelativeSizeAxes, Anchor/Orign, Padding, etc.)
  2. Converting cornerRadius to masking containers
  3. Linear Gradients (Both simple as well as multi-stop gradients work as long as they're horizontal or vertical)
  4. Text (Only one style per text element supported)
plugins.tagline: Convert Figma elements into osu!framework snippets
